[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_move_from()] [Optional Value] Only charges if val is Some(). Can failed move_from attempts be repeated without gas cost? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_move_from()] [Resource Deletion] Moving resources from storage should be expensive. Is the gas cost sufficient to prevent storage exhaustion attacks? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_move_to()] [Success-Based Charging] Similar to borrow_global, only charges on success. Can failed move_to be retried infinitely? (High)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_move_to()] [Storage Write Cost] Does value size alone represent the true cost of writing to global storage? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_pack()] [Vector Creation] Charges based on args.len(). Can creating vectors with MAX elements cause gas overflow? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_pack()] [Element Size Ignored] Only counts elements, not their sizes. Can packing large elements be undercharged? (Medium)
[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_len()] [Fixed Cost] Vector length has fixed cost regardless of vector size. Is this appropriate? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_borrow()] [Borrow Cost] Fixed cost for vector element borrow. Can borrowing expensive elements be exploited? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_push_back()] [Value Size] Charges based on pushed value size. Can pushing to already-large vectors be undercharged? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_pop_back()] [Optional Value] The _val parameter is ignored. Should successful vs failed pops have different costs? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_unpack()] [Opcode Mismatch] Uses VEC_PUSH_BACK opcode instead of VEC_UNPACK. Is this a bug that can be exploited? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_unpack()] [Element Count] Charges based on expect_num_elements, not actual _elems. Can mismatch be exploited? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_vec_swap()] [Fixed Swap Cost] Swapping vector elements has fixed cost. Can swapping large elements be undercharged? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_drop_frame()] [Frame Cleanup] Returns Ok() without charging. Can dropping frames with many locals occur without gas cost? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_drop_frame()] [Iterator Ignored] The locals iterator is unused. Should local cleanup be charged based on number and size? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_create_ty()] [Type Creation] Returns Ok() without charging. Can complex type construction exhaust resources without gas? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: charge_create_ty()] [Type Nodes Ignored] num_nodes parameter is unused. Can deeply nested generic types be created for free? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: new_from_instructions()] [Sorting Assumption] Instructions are sorted by instruction_key. Can incorrect sorting cause wrong gas costs to be accessed? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: new_from_instructions()] [Variant Count Check] Debug assertion checks VARIANT_COUNT coverage. Can missing instructions in release builds cause panics? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: new_from_instructions()] [Index Calculation] The check (index == (key - 1)) verifies ordering. Can off-by-one errors cause wrong cost lookups? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: new_from_instructions()] [Vector Construction] The instruction_table is built from iterator. Can iterator manipulation inject wrong costs? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/test-utils/src/gas_schedule.rs] [Function: zero_cost_instruction_table()] [Genesis Usage] Used for genesis and testing. Can zero-cost schedules leak into production causing free execution? (Critical)
